title: Painting Found In Woman's Kitchen Sold For Rs 2.66 Crore, She Had No Idea It Was THAT Precious!
text:
Painting Found In Woman's Kitchen Sold For Rs 2.66 Crore, She Had No Idea It Was THAT Precious!

Painting Found In Woman's Kitchen Sold For Rs 2.66 Crore, She Had No Idea It Was THAT Precious!

Most of us get excited when we find a Rs 10 note in a pair of jeans, or jacket, that we have not worn for a while. Now, what if you found something in your house that could potentially make your richer by Rs 2.66 crore? It was just a painting for this elderly French woman, but it turned out to be a precious piece of art that surprisingly turned her into a millionaire!

An old painting was found in her kitchen, and she had never really paid a lot of attention to it; it was just something she had lying around.

According to AP, the painting was made by an Italian painter Cimabue, that was sold for $26.6 million (Rs 2.66 crore), on Sunday. The painting was sold to an anonymous buyer near Chantilly, North of Paris, by Dominique Le Coent of Acteon Auction House.

“It’s a painting that was unique, splendid and monumental. Cimabue was the father of the Renaissance. But this sale goes beyond all our dreams,” Le Coent told Associated Press. The painting is called the ‘Christ Mocked’ and it measures about 10 inches by 8 inches.

After an auctioneer spotted the painting in the woman’s house during inspection, he told her to bring it to the experts for evaluation. The painting was hung on the wall between the kitchen and dining room. The auction house said that the woman will get maximum amount of money from the sale.

“There’s never been a Cimabue painting on sale so there was no reference previously on how much it could make,” Le Coent explained.

Also known as Cenni di Pepo or Cenni di Pepi, Cimabue was an Italian painter. He is generally regarded as one of the first great Italian painters to break from the Italo-Byzantine style.

You might want to scan your house for any hidden treasures you might have lying around.
